DOC.brief_summary: The Building Futures Youth ( BFY ) project pilot intervention program 6th grade student parent District Columbia public school system . The full intervention include student 6th , 7th 8th grade . The primary overall goal project help student learn make healthy life choice delay sexual initiation . Sixth-grade child parent four Washington , D.C. , public school recruit study . Children two school participate BFY intervention program child two school serve control . Participants guide three study phase , phase span one school year , follow : Sixth-grade student give foundation goal setting , decision-making communication skill . They gain knowledge puberty , reproduction , negative consequence associate child young age . They learn strategy get situation feel pressured engage sexual activity . Through lesson , activity , discussion give tool answer follow question : - Who I ? Students engage self-reflection activity discussion allow become aware value , belief strength , increase self-esteem positive self-image . - What I want life ? Students engage goal-setting activity , create short-term long-term goal map necessary step achieve goal . - How I get ? Students instruct decision-making , problem-solving communication skill . - How sex early affect life goal I want achieve ? Students explore negative impact engage sexual activity early get pregnant get someone pregnant emotional , social financial life . Seventh grade student give tool skill necessary deal variety challenge may experience developmental year . They receive comprehensive sex education , conjunction life skill relationship negotiation , date skill , violence prevention problem-solving skill . Eighth grade student guided series activity encourage student translate knowledge gain 6th 7th grade phase long-term behavioral change risk reduction . Activities include write perform skill , create informational pamphlet , design T-shirts create poetry affirms BFY message . In addition , student participate program community service project , Anacostia River clean-up coordinate Earth Conservation Corps Martin Luther King Day event coordinate Howard University 's Community Association Project Change .
